nodes.bodyText: Please make a new MapStruct mapper for this. There's a guide and tutorial in the top level README.
nit: Usually I'd use @Mock for mocking value objects (and @MockBean for beans). There may be a reason not to do so here.
I would have expected the creator to be a field passed in to buildDbWorkspace.
Is there anything else you can verify?
If you're using a real DAO, then you should be able to fetch the saved object and compare fields.
i actually do not need to verify this, the purpose of this test is to ensure the creator information is different

and i am verifying the RdrWorkspace converted object attribute value is matched via
verify(mockRdrApi).exportWorkspaces(Arrays.asList(rdrWorkspace));
With fluent constructsors or builders, please break before every new parameter.

so spotlessApply is putting them in one line. i had it like ....
.userId(2l)
.familyName("email")
.givenName("icannothas"));
ok. Spotless isn't the best poet.
Yay! look how small it is!
This is great, but even better would be to have the fields named the same way.
It's better if we can order them by source, target, and then use a string utility to alphabetize them.

We've already got different names for the db and model classes here, and now the RDR model is yet another mapping. This is just way more complicated than it needs to be. But the mapper sweeps it all under the rug in a really nice way.
For anything you need to ignore, please put a comment indicating why it's required/safe/desired.

nit: you can get around all ternary operators if you just set all the flages to unset first, then iterate over the enums and use a mapping function, sort of like the PropertyMapper class. Probably too fancy to bother with, but it's a neat trick.
So it'd be like AccessToCare.setRdrFlag(rdrDemogrphic); You can just zip down the set and call the setRdrFlag() method on each one for the thing and avoid all the branching.

You may want to find out when this returns null. Maybe a unit test there. In general, if you have to do a filter on non-null, there might be a constraint you could add upstream so this doesn't happen. Not always though.
please add a description about this ID. Like is it for our database or some other thing?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -237,6 +240,22 @@ definitions:
           - ACTIVE
           - INACTIVE
 
+  RdrWorkspaceCreator:
+    type: object
+    description: Details for workspace creator
+    required:
+      - userId
+      - givenName
+      - familyName
+    properties:
+      userId:
+        type: integer
